titles.title: Nevada National Forest Land Disposal Act of 2003
Nevada National Forest Land Disposal Act of 2003
Nevada National Forest Land Disposal Act of 2003
To authorize the Secretary of Agriculture to sell certain parcels of Federal land in Carson City and Douglas County, Nevada.
To direct the Secretary of Agriculture to sell certain parcels of Federal land in Carson City and Douglas County, Nevada.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health.
Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 108-294.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 170.

action.text: Mr. Pombo moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1092.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on Public Lands and Forests. Hearings held.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

term.name: Federal aid to water resources development

bill.summary: 10/15/2003--Passed House amended. Nevada National Forest Land Disposal Act of 2003 - Requires the Secretary of Agriculture to sell at public auction any right, title, or interest of the United States in and to specified parcels of National Forest System lands in Carson City and Douglas County, Nevada. Requires the Secretary to coordinate such sales with the relevant unit of local government. Provides that the sale of such land shall be subject to existing rights in effect on the date of sale. Sets forth percentages of the gross proceeds from sales under this Act that shall be earmarked for: (1) the State of Nevada general education program; (2) the Carson Water Subconservancy District in Nevada; (3) the fund established in the Sisk Act, to be used for land sales costs and for the development and maintenance of parks, trails, and natural areas in specified Nevada counties; and (4) expansion of the Minden Interagency Dispatch Center in Minden, Nevada. Declares that the lands authorized to be sold under this Act shall not be subject to specified Federal law pertaining to property management.
